clinical_study.brief_title: Screening and Intervention of Postextubation Dysphagia
clinical_study.official_title: Screen and Intervene : A Diagnostic Accuracy Study and A Randomized Controlled Trial for Postextubation Dysphagia

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science and Technology, Taiwan

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to develop and test the accuracy of a two-step post-extubation dysphagia screening and the effects of PED Care intervention on reducing time to resume oral intake, rates of penetration and intervention at 10 days postextubation, and incidences of 30-day aspiration pneumonia in adult patients with prolonged intubation (≥48 hours) under a randomized controlled trial (RCT) design.

detailed_description.textblock: Endotracheal intubation is life-sustaining, but it may contribute to postextubation dysphagia (PED) increasing the risk of penetration, aspiration, and aspiration pneumonia. Up to 84% of extubated patients had PED and approximately 60% penetrated and aspirated that can lead to aspiration pneumonia. The aims of this three-year, two-stage study are: 1) to develop a two-step PED Screen involved oral stereognosis and cough reflex test for detecting penetration and aspiration, using a diagnostic accuracy study method; and 2) to test effects of a once daily, 7-day PED Care intervention on reducing time to resume oral intake, rates of penetration and intervention at 10 days postextubation, and incidences of 30-day aspiration pneumonia in adult patients with prolonged intubation (≥48 hours) from a medical center in Taiwan, using a randomized controlled trial (RCT) design.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The first stage is to test the accuracy of a two-step Post-extubation dysphagia screening tool. Every participants will receive the screening and FEES examination. The second stage of this study will be an intervention study. All participants will randomly assigned into the intervention or control group. The control group only receive the usual care in the unit they stay while the intervention group received additional 7-day, once-daily PED Care including oral exercise, oral cleaning and intake education.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline oral intake level in one month post-extubation
primary_outcome.description: Measured by Functional Oral Intake Scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline penetration and aspiration status in 10 days postextubation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Twice. First, for baseline assessment, it will be conducted within 48 hrs post-extubation after post-extubation dysphagia screening. Secondly, it will be conducted at 10-day post-extubation for every participants.
primary_outcome.description: Measured by Fiberoptic endoscopic evaluation of swallowing (FEES), a dysphagia diagnostic tool

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline incidence of aspiration pneumonia in one month post-extubation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once, on the 30th day after extubation
primary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by Chest X-ray and interpretate by Pulmonologist

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Nasogastric tube insertion rate in 10th day post-extubation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice, once within 48 hours post-extubation. Secondly, record it on the 10th day post-extubation.
secondary_outcome.description: To record the rate of participants who are still using nasogastric tube

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline unstimulated salivary rate in 10th day post-extubation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice, once within 48 hours post-extubation. Secondly, record it on the 10th day post-extubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline oral health status in 10th day post-extubation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice, once within 48 hours post-extubation. Secondly, record it on the 10th day post-extubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline lip closure and lingual diadochokinetic ability in 10th day post-extubation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice, once within 48 hours post-extubation. Secondly, record it on the 10th day post-extubation.

arm_group.description: Received PED care addition to usual care

intervention.description: A once daily, 7-day PED Care intervention on reducing time to resume oral intake, rates of penetration and intervention at 10 days postextubation, and incidences of 30-day aspiration pneumonia in adult patients with prolonged intubation (≥48 hours)
Using FEES to see if participants have any aspiration or penetration and the level of it.
usual care means the original care given by the ward the participants stay.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient who is over 20 years old.
- Patient how has received over 48 hours endotracheal intubation and had been successfully extubated.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who has neurological deficits or disorders, eg. cerebrovascular disease, Parkinson disease, spinal injury.
- Patient who has innate / acquired oropharyngeal abnormality
- Patient who received tracheostomy after extubation.
- Patient who has already had swallowing dysfunction before endotracheal intubation
- Patient who cannot follow the instruction and interact with people.
- Patient who needs absolute quarantine, eg. Open Tuberculosis patients, Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) patients
